resource.description: Public Works service requests from 2003 to 2016. Data includes information on service requests received by Public Works. Where the service request was initiated by 311 the service request number from 311 is also included.

resource.name: Community Survey Summary Results - 2012 to 2018
resource.description: The Office of Internal Audit (OIA) conducts an annual survey of Chattanooga residents to gather their views of city services. This dataset is a summary file of the overall satisfaction scores from 2012 to 2018.  - See more at: http://www.chattanooga.gov/internal-audit/community-surveys
columns_description: In the last 12 months, about how many times, if ever, have you or other household members visited a Chattanooga Public Library branch? (1 time to more than 10)
Overall, how do you rate following aspects of City government performance: Overall direction the City is taking? (Very Good & Good)
Overall, how do you rate the quality of animal control (McKamey)? (Very Good & Good)
Overall, how do you rate the quality of experiences at Memorial Auditorium and/or Tivoli? (Very Good & Good)
Overall, how do you rate the quality of bus services (CARTA)? (Very Good & Good)
In the last 12 months, about how many times, if ever, have you or other household members been involved in a community project or attended a public meeting? (1 time to more than 10)
In the last 12 months, about how many times, if ever, have you or other household members visited the Chattanooga.gov website? (1 time to more than 10)
If yes, how many employees does your business employ? (50 or less)
How do you rate Chattanooga as a place to do business? (Very Good & Good)
How do you rate your neighborhood on availability of sidewalks? (Very Good & Good)
How do you rate your neighborhood on walking distance to public transit? (Very Good & Good)
How do you rate your neighborhood on physical condition of housing? (Very Good & Good)
If yes, how do you rate it on improvement to your neighborhood as a place to live? (Very Good & Good)
If yes, how do you rate it on attractiveness? (Very Good & Good)

How do you rate your satisfaction with the following City services: Sewers? (Very Satisfied & Somewhat Satisfied)
How do you rate your satisfaction with the following City services: Yard-waste Pick-up? (Very Satisfied & Somewhat Satisfied)

resource.name: Combined Community Survey Numerical Results
resource.description: This data set is comprised of the 2012 to 2018 Community Survey results sent out by Internal Audit.  The survey responses are mostly text responses, i.e. Very Bad to Very Good, Very Satisfied to Very Dissatisfied.  These responses have been converted in this file to be numerical numbers from 1 to 5 in order to assist in creation of more numerically informational visualizaitons

resource.name: PILOT Agreements
resource.description: PILOT Agreements through the City of Chattanooga and Hamilton County.
columns_name: City Payments Billed in Lieu of Taxes
Hamilton County School Tax Without PILOT Agreement
Hamilton County General Tax Without PILOT Agreement
Total Payments In Lieu of Taxes
Hamilton County School Payments Billed in Lieu of Taxes
Hamilton County Payments Billed in Lieu of Taxes
columns_description: Incentive received as part of the PILOT agreement. This value is the difference of the taxes that would have been paid without the PILOT and the payments in lieu of taxes received from the company.
Company payments to City of Chattanooga  in lieu of taxes based on the PILOT agreement.

Hamilton County School taxes that would have been required if the PILOT was not present. 

Based on the School Tax portion of  Hamilton County millage rate of $2.7652 dollars per $100 of assessed value for the

Hamilton County General taxes that would have been required if the PILOT was not present. 


Based on the General Tax portion of  Hamilton County millage rate of $2.7652 dollars per $100 of assessed value for the
Incentive received as part of the PILOT agreement. This value is the difference of the taxes that would have been paid without the PILOT and the payments in lieu of taxes received from the company.
Incentive received as part of the PILOT agreement. This value is the difference of the taxes that would have been paid without the PILOT and the payments in lieu of taxes received from the company.
Company total payments in lieu of taxes based on the PILOT agreement.

City of Chattanooga taxes that would have been required if the PILOT was not present. 

Based on the millage rate of $2.309 dollars per $100 of assessed value.
Incentive received as part of the PILOT agreement. This value is the difference of the taxes that would have been paid without the PILOT and the payments in lieu of taxes received from the company.
A fee sometimes included as part of PILOT agreements.
Company payments to Hamilton County Schools  in lieu of taxes based on the PILOT agreement.
Total taxes that would have been required if the PILOT was not present.

10a In the past 12 months, how many times did you: Visit any city park? (Daily & Weekly)
9d How do you rate your satisfaction with the following City services: Water Quality of Lakes and Streams? (Very Satisfied & Somewhat Satisfied)
9e How do you rate your satisfaction with the following City services: Storm Drainage? (Very Satisfied & Somewhat Satisfied)
9c How do you rate your satisfaction with the following City services: Curbside Recycling? (Very Satisfied & Somewhat Satisfied)
8c If yes, how do you rate the services you received on speed of emergency response? (Very Good & Good)
21a Overall, how do you rate the quality of 3-1-1? (Very Good & Good)
20e In the last 12 months, about how many times, if ever, have you or other household members used/visited McKamey Animal Center? (1 time to more than 10)
20f In the last 12 months, about how many times, if ever, have you or other household members visited the Chattanooga.gov website? (1 time to more than 10)
20c In the last 12 months, about how many times, if ever, have you or other household members visited a Chattanooga Public Library branch? (1 time to more than 10)
20b In the last 12 months, about how many times, if ever, have you or other household members ridden a local bus (CARTA)? (1 time to more than 10)
22b Overall, how do you rate following aspects of City government performance: Overall direction the City is taking? (Very Good & Good)
22c Overall, how do you rate following aspects of City government performance: Welcoming citizen involvement? (Very Good & Good)
21f Overall, how do you rate the quality of chattanooga.gov website? (Very Good & Good)
21e Overall, how do you rate the quality of public libraries? (Very Good & Good)
18b How do you rate your neighborhood on physical condition of housing? (Very Good & Good)
18c How do you rate your neighborhood on closeness of parks or open spaces? (Very Good & Good)
17c If yes, how do you rate it on improvement to your neighborhood as a place to live? (Very Good & Good)
17b If yes, how do you rate it on attractiveness? (Very Good & Good)
19b Do you own a business in Chattanooga? (Yes)
18h How do you rate your neighborhood on availability of sidewalks? (Very Good & Good)
19a How do you rate Chattanooga as a place to do business? (Very Good & Good)
18f How do you rate your neighborhood on on-street parking? (Very Good & Good)
18e How do you rate your neighborhood on access to shopping and other services? (Very Good & Good)
